pullRequest.body:
Move the algebraic instance on `Fin n` from `Data.Fin.Basic` to a new file `Algebra.Group.Fin`. I credit Yakov for https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/5010.

The one bit of algebra that is still imported in `Data.Fin.Basic` is `NeZero`. This is in prevision of its future upstreaming to Batteries or Std.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
* `+` [NeZero
* `+` instNatCast
* `+` natCast_def
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

> * `+` [NeZero

@adomani, another formatting issue here!
This presumably comes from a nameless instance: do you have any suggestion of what to print instead?
Probably `instance : typeOfInstance` is fine, even if `typeOfInstance` doesn't contain all the binders (because some of them are declared in `variable` and you're using a regex).

@YaelDillies, with the changes in #12935, the `move-decls` bot would have report what is below for this PR:

---

* `+` instance [NeZero n] {a : â„•} : OfNat (Fin n) a where
* `+` instNatCast
* `+` natCast_def
Amazing! Can you get rid of `where`/`:=`? That's just noise here

With the update that I just pushed, you would see here:

---

* `+` instance [NeZero n] {a : â„•} : OfNat (Fin n) a
* `+` instNatCast
* `+` natCast_def
bors merge

> With the update that I just pushed, you would see here:
> 
> * `+` instance [NeZero n] {a : â„•} : OfNat (Fin n) a
> * `+` instNatCast
> * `+` natCast_def

Is there a reason why the backticks are around the `+` and `-` instead of around the lemma names?

EDIT: Oh I see, there's bad interaction with markdown. Maybe we can put everything in a code block instead?
```
+ instance [NeZero n] {a : â„•} : OfNat (Fin n) a
+ instNatCast
+ natCast_def
```

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9100021727/job/25013912999)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9100021727/job/25013914531)
maintainer merge
maintainer merge

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion import Mathlib.Data.Fin.Basic ```

nodes.body:
@YaelDillies, with the changes in #12935, the `move-decls` bot would have report what is below for this PR:

---

* `+` instance [NeZero n] {a : â„•} : OfNat (Fin n) a where
* `+` instNatCast
* `+` natCast_def
Amazing! Can you get rid of `where`/`:=`? That's just noise here

With the update that I just pushed, you would see here:

---

* `+` instance [NeZero n] {a : â„•} : OfNat (Fin n) a
* `+` instNatCast
* `+` natCast_def

> With the update that I just pushed, you would see here:
> 
> * `+` instance [NeZero n] {a : â„•} : OfNat (Fin n) a
> * `+` instNatCast
> * `+` natCast_def

Is there a reason why the backticks are around the `+` and `-` instead of around the lemma names?

EDIT: Oh I see, there's bad interaction with markdown. Maybe we can put everything in a code block instead?
```
+ instance [NeZero n] {a : â„•} : OfNat (Fin n) a
+ instNatCast
+ natCast_def
```
